verbose_text: Lactose not only causes an increase in intestinal water content (via increased osmotic load in the ileum) but is also readily fermented by the colonic microbiota, which leads to production of short-chain fatty acids and gas : Mainly hydrogen (H 2), carbon dioxide (CO 2), and methane (CH 4) [XREF_BIBR].
evidence: Lactose not only causes an increase in intestinal water
